comments.text: Which branches still need an update before we shutdown all packet.net machines? I spotted recent pushes from mozilla-beta and I believe ESR still pushes to there too. Also, many people didn't update their local branches which cause many try pushes go to packet workers.
comments.author: wcosta@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: Which branches still need an update before we shutdown all packet.net machines? I spotted recent pushes from mozilla-beta and I believe ESR still pushes to there too. Also, many people didn't update their local branches which cause many try pushes go to packet workers.
comments.creator: wcosta@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text: packet.net pool has now only 10 machines alive. They need to stay until esr68 branch gets updated.
comments.text: packet.net pool has now only 10 machines alive. They need to stay until esr68 branch gets updated.
comments.creator: wcosta@mozilla.com
comments.author: wcosta@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text: I've landed the required changes on beta and esr68 (but not release). We merge beta -> release on 2020-05-25, and ship on 2020-06-02. I think we can turn of the workers on or after 2020-06-08 (a week after release). That will just leave the NSS workers.
comments.creator: mozilla@hocat.ca

comments.text:
(In reply to Tom Prince [:tomprince] from comment #3)
> I've landed the required changes on beta and esr68 (but not release). We merge beta -> release on 2020-05-25, and ship on 2020-06-02. I think we can turn of the workers on or after 2020-06-08 (a week after release). That will just leave the NSS workers.

I am fine with this. Thanks.
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Tom Prince [:tomprince] from comment #3)
> I've landed the required changes on beta and esr68 (but not release). We merge beta -> release on 2020-05-25, and ship on 2020-06-02. I think we can turn of the workers on or after 2020-06-08 (a week after release). That will just leave the NSS workers.

I am fine with this. Thanks.

(In reply to Tom Prince [:tomprince] from comment #3)
> I've landed the required changes on beta and esr68 (but not release). We merge beta -> release on 2020-05-25, and ship on 2020-06-02. I think we can turn of the workers on or after 2020-06-08 (a week after release). That will just leave the NSS workers.

AFAICT the transition happened as expected last week, i.e. mozilla-release tests that were running on terraform-packet/gecko-t-linux workers are now running on gecko-t/t-linux-metal workers. 

Tom: can you please confirm that I am OK to decomm the remaining packet instances?
